channel.title: A-Frame
channel.description: A web framework for building virtual reality experiences. Make WebVR with HTML and Entity-Component. Works on Vive, Rift, desktop, mobile platforms.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 111 - 114
item.description:
‚úàÔ∏è Supercraft taking off the runway! Build VR worlds with your hands, all within VR. Then publish to the Web and share your creation with just a link to view on any device üí£ @aframevr #webvr https://t.co/SyRFI1qfJK pic.twitter.com/aW1zOEASfv

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) June 6, 2018

Supercraft by @supermediumvr is a fascinating, easy and above all FUN way to craft #webvr objects and environments directly in VR. Aside from some less-than-ideal UX in some areas I absolutely loved it! Here's my first creation: The Cheetornado‚Ñ¢ https://t.co/AthwPnIKKE pic.twitter.com/RRcoWKfggy

— Jorge Fuentes (@jorgefuentesnet) June 8, 2018

Create a navigation mesh from an existing @aframevr scene, without leaving the browser ‚Äî new A-Frame Inspector plugin! Thanks to @but0n97 for the help with Recast. üôÇhttps://t.co/nlEtmEAjCq

// #webvr #threejs pic.twitter.com/jCWIxcTRPN

— Don McCurdy @ EYEO (@donrmccurdy) May 29, 2018

Just completed Trajectile Command! A free #webvr action game using @aframevr. Defend your cities from missiles and bombers. Inspired by an old arcade classic. Try it out here: https://t.co/6vL9vyfDSQ Requires vive, occulus or windows mr #vr #gamedev #indiedev pic.twitter.com/i2FDj2q2yv

— Adam Alexander (@AdamAlexandr) May 23, 2018

I've updated Trajectile Command with a high score leaderboard and a kickin sound track. Try it out on @supermediumvr or another vr browser here: https://t.co/6vL9vyfDSQ ‚Ä¶ Can you beat my high score?? @aframevr #VR #webvr #webgl pic.twitter.com/vy9oQYaO6K

— Adam Alexander (@AdamAlexandr) June 3, 2018

Hey #webrebels! Here's the link to my slides: https://t.co/dt4TKpj6x4 and here's the link to the demo: https://t.co/37XqHpaG0Y #WebXR @aframevr

— Monika Kedrova (@salad_milk_soup) June 6, 2018

Published my first @github repo, a joystick component for @aframevr that allows WASD-like motion on mobile! Uses @yoannm's NippleJS and lightly adapted for aframe

Repo: https://t.co/EjHT3MRrcr pic.twitter.com/horlAD5Ppn

— Michael Turck (@turckalicious) May 25, 2018

Great news - @officialjanusvr is opening up their Vesta VR hosting service to support other WebVR frameworks, starting with @aframevr https://t.co/qzc7UPdnQw

— James Baicoianu (@bai0) May 20, 2018

Composure has new updates! Check out https://t.co/KGSSf2ujNR! Brand new landing page, #WebVR experience now has controller support, added physics, new navigation & environment! Thx to @ianpetrarca for his brilliance and diligence. Thx @aframevr for making it possible to build!

— Jeff McSpadden (@macspaddy) May 31, 2018

Check out the new updated version of our #webgl Camry Configurator, built using @aframevr and #threejs üôå https://t.co/rO8pUJwgsf pic.twitter.com/3umySnTMp8

— Rotor Studios (@rotorstudios) June 4, 2018

Projects

üë®‚ÄçüöÄ Built this rocket after the #supercraft launch. Took literally a couple minutes from start to finish to published on the Web! https://t.co/eVWa4TWfVR (p.s., need to drag the camera around, rocket is behind). pic.twitter.com/P1FrXGU35K

An @aframevr component that provides and normalizes directional events for thumbpads (e.g., Vive) and thumbsticks (e.g., Oculus Touch) such as thumbleftstart and thumbleftend. Trigonometry by @feiss. https://t.co/AR7lsOJnJw

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 106 - 110
item.description:
I'm unbelievably excited to share a preview release of Hubs by Mozilla, a new Mixed Reality-based communications platform we are building. All open source, and all running in your browser, powered by WebVR. Really!https://t.co/AtYqAn2qam

— Greg Fodor (@gfodor) April 26, 2018

For those who missed it, you can check my little #webVR experiment "Ye Olde Puppetrilla" here - https://t.co/TGBKHG4KyU It won first prize at the @mozillareality webVR challenge and was made with @aframevr. You'll need an #HTCVive, #Oculus Rift or #microsoft #mixedreality headset pic.twitter.com/j257wxzoTo

— Jorge Fuentes (@jorgefuentesnet) May 2, 2018

Soundboxing (Beta) is one of the premiere #webvr @aframevr apps. We helped a bit on it, only took it a few days to get into shipshape. Now people are getting themselves into shipshape! Via @supermediumvr on Oculus / Steam. https://t.co/QuL2xk0T6B

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) April 24, 2018

Can you get to the Top 10?? SUPER SAYS, a simon clone for VR, available on @supermediumvr for 6dof controllers (#Oculus #HTCVive #mixedreality) https://t.co/DHivKcO0Bh 1 day to create, 2 weeks to polish ¬Ø_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø pic.twitter.com/gY7gkLqk60

— Diego F. Goberna (@feiss) May 2, 2018

A-Frame 0.8.2 just shipped üö¢ Fixes for bugs that slipped into 0.8.0. Upgrading your WebVR awesomeness to 0.8.2 is the perfect Sunday plan üåû@aframevr Change details: https://t.co/ufupCNDzE1

— Diego (@dmarcos) April 15, 2018

ü•ö Gunters of OASIS #webvr @aframevr source code. Check out the link / portal shader, custom teleport meshes, v2 of environment component with secondary dressings, world generation scripts. https://t.co/518uP5Y0ZX

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) April 30, 2018

Our @mozillareality @aframevr + @Sketchfab #WebVR Medieval Challenge is over!!! üéâüéâüéâ
Thanks to all the participants for the great entries, @Lady_Ada_King for helping reviewing them and congrats to the winners!!!! https://t.co/8VpzT6WKKa pic.twitter.com/LeTUAN8pZM

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) May 1, 2018

8000 Github ‚≠ês for @aframevr. Long live <a-entity>.

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) May 2, 2018

Our @mozillareality @aframevr + @Sketchfab #WebVR Medieval Challenge is over!!! üéâüéâüéâ

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) May 2, 2018

Projects

Sneak preview‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/CAH7nXdqfI

— Don McCurdy (@donrmccurdy) May 3, 2018

Traverse Mt Etna, Sicily, via ground, air, or X-wing with @aframevr
Try @ https://t.co/7xQvTEzcsO
Credit to Gary Phelps for his top X-wing model - https://t.co/Bbd2ZBMBPw#MayThe4thBeWithYou pic.twitter.com/7R7bDHsh69

— Mark Lane (@Convert3D) May 4, 2018

I am honored that my #AFrameVR #WebVR experience was chosen as one of the 3 winners of the WebVR Experience Challenge! Thank you!

All the winners here:https://t.co/bdPeJdbTOW pic.twitter.com/0zIvF5MnEa

— theDart76 (@theDart76) May 2, 2018

Go check out this lovely little @aframevr procgen tree experiment @presstube made!https://t.co/COm733wvDp pic.twitter.com/Aul7gWCCtr

— Cwervo (@acwervo) May 2, 2018

Still a work in progress, but Google Poly search and resizing is working √∞¬ü¬§¬ó #aframevr #WebVR pic.twitter.com/DHQt5uWsvg

— Nathaniel (@banada) April 28, 2018

#screenshotsaturday @aframevr Finished off all the enemies in Trajectile Command this weekend. There's missiles, multi-missiles, bombers and smart bombs. The terrible aiming is the computer firing at random. #webvr pic.twitter.com/AWnF6IBf1h

— Adam Alexander (@AdamAlexandr) April 29, 2018

Looked a little empty here so I built a small neighborhood with @aframevr @poly and #ARjs pic.twitter.com/KwGeZdNJz5

— Michael Turck (@turckalicious) April 9, 2018

I've been posting a lot of #dataviz fails, but on the whole this #webvr visualization of lineages traversing fitness landscapes is pretty effective. And now it's got an actual UI! Built with @aframevr. https://t.co/bMqehbXoKT pic.twitter.com/vxWCfGd5YM

— Emily Dolson (@emilyldolson) April 11, 2018

Messing around with wasm-bindgen, realized I can create a whole @aframevr scene from inside Rust, and sure enough it works like a charm! pic.twitter.com/aj9uSKZV2T

— Cwervo (@acwervo) April 17, 2018

Working on an @aframevr installation! A sculptural piece made using head tracking ‚Äî this is using a simple line but I hope to get to generative geometry by this weekend :)https://t.co/z3NTkfbVDS pic.twitter.com/Y0QPl9wr3S

— Cwervo (@acwervo) May 1, 2018

Components

Working on my first @aframevr component - Turn any picture of food into a VR-ready dish! #aframe #webvr #vr pic.twitter.com/4K4cXTyYyh

— Nathaniel (@banada) April 8, 2018

Added declarative for-loop rendering from arrays to @aframevr State Component, which is becoming a lot like its own @vuejs-like framework. https://t.co/K9T92UJI3n

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) April 9, 2018

Added comparisons to @aframevr state component:
<a-entity id="searchResults" bind__visible="page === 'search'">https://t.co/9EQUNiUOQv

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) April 13, 2018

If you are a fortunate owner of an Oculus Go and want to kick the tires with WebVR and @aframevr here there‚Äôs a glTF model of the controller. Thanks to @dmliao üôè Enjoy folks! üéâ https://t.co/MyJDuvxxSa

— Diego (@dmarcos) April 21, 2018

Articles

Beautiful and educational writeup of making a #webxr ecommerce experience that smoothly adapts for different platforms (including a sweet POC made in @aframevr) by @arturitu https://t.co/p0yeuH6eV2 pic.twitter.com/2VXZ4dicyM

— Kieran Farr (@kfarr) April 6, 2018

How to create a multiplayer webVR website with positional audio in 20 minutes, using @aframevr.https://t.co/Xf6o8vxTog pic.twitter.com/jK0ULVLHY5

— Asier Arranz (@asierarranz) April 10, 2018

Just some brief (maybe) thoughts on my own experiences with developing #SocialVR content in Unity and @aframevr https://t.co/xQwWcBJv4T pic.twitter.com/CrmeVfhqgg

— Anthony Scavarelli (@PlumCantaloupe) April 24, 2018

Events

I'll be speaking about WebVR at the next @ITNEXT_io meetup. Will contain some material from @fronteers, but will also delve more into @aframevr components and other frameworks. Less VR-fanboying, more VR-dev.

Also, the PWA talk is gonna be awesome!https://t.co/2K52RdVEup

— Ruben van der Leun (@rvdleun) April 9, 2018

Heading in few weeks to @OpenVisConf üóºüá´üá∑ and eager to see how @AframeVR can be used for data visualization? Check @rabimba 's workshop "Visualize your Data in a 3D #VR world using A-Frame in #WebVR"! https://t.co/GEjN4OWkhj pic.twitter.com/tNIvKNn9IT

— Fabien ‚úà‚òÄÔ∏èüé•VRLA (@utopiah) April 10, 2018

So stoked that I'll be speaking at @WeAreDevs in Vienna next month alongside a legendary speaker line up!! My talk will be about building multiplayer VR web apps using @aframevr and @ablyrealtime \o/ #realtime #VirtualReality #webvr @mozTechSpeakers

— Srushtika Neelakantam (@Srushtika) April 18, 2018

How would it feel to actually walk in your data?ü§î
Don't ponder too much just bring your dataset and we will explore it in #VR together! Come with all your questions for an exciting @AFrameVR+@D3js_org workshop Wednesday 16 at @OpenVisConf Paris.

Details: https://t.co/GEjN4OWkhj pic.twitter.com/jBuqZEbDov

— Fabien ‚úà‚òÄÔ∏èüé•VRLA (@utopiah) April 25, 2018

Miscellaneous

Tried #VivePro last night with various apps like with #ChromaLab, #DestinationsVR, as well as my own @aframevr project via @supermediumvr. The headset feels lighter and theres less eye strain. Clarity of UI and typography is a game changer for VR design and it improves immersion. pic.twitter.com/zQ13wUHqq8

— Vishnu Ganti (@vishnuganti) April 10, 2018

Working I a cafe: I built a xylophone with @aframevr and the web audio API for a tutorial, and now have a kid playing with it occupying my MacBook. üòù

item.description:
A-Frame 0.8.0 is out for everybody to enjoy! This release was the most complex so far. Thanks to @machenmusik @arturitu @donrmccurdy @fernandojsg @reeder29 and all of you that contributed filing bugs, testing and staying on top of things. https://t.co/CusqqHb7Up

— Diego (@dmarcos) March 9, 2018

I've just released an @aframevr component to pan, rotate and scale the user camera on #webvr, inspired by VR editors like #UnrealEngine and #unity3d. #threejs version coming soon :) https://t.co/bDyWnZVbcH pic.twitter.com/iNF97dhpZy

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) February 28, 2018

I'm so late to the @aframevr + @glitch party but I üëèüèº am üëèüèº here üëèüèº now. Cannot believe how fast I can make/run a vr scene. Thank you awesome ppl at @Fasility_VR ! pic.twitter.com/JfW7g4KSLN

— Melissa Teng (@melisteng) March 18, 2018

Landed first changes to @aframevr today! Mostly tests to verify a small bug fix in the event model before I start on the @Oculus Go controls component! Highly recommend working with this project, very well supported/tested. #WebVR https://t.co/sPuiSljJNn

— Justin Rogers (@JustRogDigiTec) March 19, 2018

#WebVR has arrived in Steam through @supermediumvr! Serving WebVR to the heads of VR users. Distribute your content on Steam via the Web. Try it out! üöÄ https://t.co/z6dKLtp8DF

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) March 6, 2018

√∞¬ü¬î¬ç Search over a thousand and counting #webvr sites on https://t.co/D55A1g1Gq9! Including VR sites from @WITHIN, @Matterport, @Sketchfab, and @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/SwDZvLtLAk

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) March 5, 2018

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) March 9, 2018

— Anthony Scavarelli (@PlumCantaloupe) March 19, 2018

Perf update to @aframevr animation component. Skip setAttribute overhead for color animations. Animate directly.

animation="property: components.text.material.uniforms.color.value; isRawProperty: true; from: red; to: blue; type: color"https://t.co/T1tGyFbfPt

Made a simple @aframevr component for cascading opacity to children entities (like in css where the parent opacity applies to the children): https://t.co/sVRkOCLaDy pic.twitter.com/Sm4c4Dl1AU

The beginning stages of a cathedral I'm building in WebVR with @aframevr üôè pic.twitter.com/vn8FyGygFM

— Mozilla Hacks (@mozhacks) March 7, 2018

— Fahima Zulfath Akbar (@FahimaZulfath) March 6, 2018

We are teaching @aframevr at the @publicvrlab in #Boston again! Build on the foundation and make your #WebVR do more! https://t.co/pxm1bla2eZ

Experiments tried out by the attendees which I admired @aframevr @mozillaTN @mozilla @WebVRrocks @mozillareality @MozillaIN pic.twitter.com/nMomvgHc3F

— Bhuvana Meenakshi (@bhuvanakotees1) March 17, 2018

Learning about @aframevr for #webvr thanks to @RobWebDev at #energizedlabs #meetup @energizedwork pic.twitter.com/ojSsXtghCb

@supermediumvr at the #WebXR meetup NYC pic.twitter.com/xXOgnADfAk

item.title: A-Frame v0.8.0 - Performance and Production
item.description:
The A-Frame train continues! v0.8.0 has been released, bringing many, many performance improvements through being battle-tested in production applications. Notably, we ported many fixes and performance through building out Supermedium using A-Frame!

We hit A Week of A-Frame 100, highlighting the long way we‚Äôve come such that there are companies and startups taking the leap with A-Frame. There‚Äôs even an A-Frame application published on Steam VR! Including:

  • Ottifox - A nimble design app that helps you create VR and AR prototypes that run in the browser - without writing code.
  • Halo Labs - VR/AR design, prototyping, and collaboration solution for teams.
  • Archilogic - Turn floor plans into virtual tours.
  • Vragments - Build and publish your own 360 story.
  • Scapic - Create immersive worlds.
  • Lucid Web - WebVR player.
  • Ideaspace - CMS.
  • Supermedium - The virtual reality browser.

Alongside many other companies!

What‚Äôs New?

The biggest change is allowing to modify three.js Object3D position, rotation, scale, and visible directly while still maintining in sync in the A-Frame layer. There is currently overhead with .setAttribute, but all of that can be skipped for position, rotation, scale, visible by directly modifying three.js Object3D. That is a simple object property change. Since object transformations are one of the most often updated things, this saves on a lot of overhead. In general, we begin to try to find ways to skip .setAttribute when able.

Lots of other performance improvements, both in the core of A-Frame and in top A-Frame community components (e.g., animation). We scoured a lot of the codebase removing unnecessary memory allocations and event emissions.

We‚Äôve also upgraded to three.js‚Äôs WebVR API, which was a long and grueling process to integrate and catch all the bugs, but we did it! Still a lot to be done on the performance side.

The A-Frame Inspector also got a few nifty features such as tree collapsing on the entity panel, pressing f to focus on an entity, and some bug fixes.

Check out the release notes for the complete changelog which includes a list of all new features, optimizations, and bug fixes.
item.content:encoded:
The A-Frame train continues! v0.8.0 has been released, bringing many, many performance improvements through being battle-tested in production applications. Notably, we ported many fixes and performance through building out Supermedium using A-Frame!

We hit A Week of A-Frame 100, highlighting the long way we‚Äôve come such that there are companies and startups taking the leap with A-Frame. There‚Äôs even an A-Frame application published on Steam VR! Including:

  • Ottifox - A nimble design app that helps you create VR and AR prototypes that run in the browser - without writing code.
  • Halo Labs - VR/AR design, prototyping, and collaboration solution for teams.
  • Archilogic - Turn floor plans into virtual tours.
  • Vragments - Build and publish your own 360 story.
  • Scapic - Create immersive worlds.
  • Lucid Web - WebVR player.
  • Ideaspace - CMS.
  • Supermedium - The virtual reality browser.

Alongside many other companies!

What‚Äôs New?

The biggest change is allowing to modify three.js Object3D position, rotation, scale, and visible directly while still maintining in sync in the A-Frame layer. There is currently overhead with .setAttribute, but all of that can be skipped for position, rotation, scale, visible by directly modifying three.js Object3D. That is a simple object property change. Since object transformations are one of the most often updated things, this saves on a lot of overhead. In general, we begin to try to find ways to skip .setAttribute when able.

Lots of other performance improvements, both in the core of A-Frame and in top A-Frame community components (e.g., animation). We scoured a lot of the codebase removing unnecessary memory allocations and event emissions.

We‚Äôve also upgraded to three.js‚Äôs WebVR API, which was a long and grueling process to integrate and catch all the bugs, but we did it! Still a lot to be done on the performance side.

The A-Frame Inspector also got a few nifty features such as tree collapsing on the entity panel, pressing f to focus on an entity, and some bug fixes.

Check out the release notes for the complete changelog which includes a list of all new features, optimizations, and bug fixes.

What Have People Built?

Do not get hit by the car.#threejs #aframe #webvr #webxr pic.twitter.com/nEPOCVhugl

— sromline (@sromline) January 31, 2018

√∞¬ü¬ö¬Ä We√¢¬Ä¬ôre excited to announce the launch of Supermedium, the virtual reality browser! Download it from https://t.co/Lnyvgt7HBY, put on a headset, and surf dozens of VR experiences on the Web. https://t.co/2rloFZl5ko #webvr #ycombinator pic.twitter.com/6aArQKvgpn

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) January 31, 2018

Today√¢¬Ä¬ôs the day! Ottifox 2 is here - with Google Poly search built straight into the app, grouping features, streamlined UI and more! For a full run down of all the new features check out our blog post: https://t.co/pzcTTGZJz5 Examples to come! #webvr @aframe #madewithblocks #VR pic.twitter.com/6FfpLZjpqJ

— Ottifox (@ottifox) February 6, 2018

I've just released an @aframevr component to pan, rotate and scale the user camera on #webvr, inspired by VR editors like #UnrealEngine and #unity3d. #threejs version coming soon :) https://t.co/bDyWnZVbcH pic.twitter.com/iNF97dhpZy

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) February 28, 2018

Starting to look familiar. #WebVR browser game with @aframevr. Added cities you must defend from incoming missiles. #indiedev #gamedev pic.twitter.com/GtPcIJL7on

— Adam Alexander (@AdamAlexandr) January 7, 2018

We√¢¬Ä¬ôre proud to announce the launch of our first WebVR experience! Visit Pierre Koenig√¢¬Ä¬ôs Case Study House 22 in full 3D on your HTC Vive, desktop, or mobile device. Check it out! https://t.co/SljvOHRnQ2#VR #webvr #aframe #threejs #losangeles #midcentury #modern #architecture pic.twitter.com/iM8AJ8DYT3

— Paragram (@ParagramVR) November 19, 2017

Try √¢¬Ä¬úc o m p o s u r e√¢¬Ä¬ù - immersive experience for stress relief. Built with @aframevr, its #WebVR & #3daudio for desktop, mobile and #VR! Many thanks to @ianpetrarca & @datavized for their skills, wisdom and guidance. Try it. PM me your feedback. Share! : https://t.co/bENdn6U5uk pic.twitter.com/VgYfFLfMbD

— Jeff McSpadden (@macspaddy) February 9, 2018

Numbers

Since v0.7.0 was released in September 20th, 2017:

  • There have been 30 new contributors, totalling 223.
  • We have 1246 new members in the Slack community for a total of 5980.
  • 202,000 people have visited aframe.io since last release.

What‚Äôs Next?

We will continue performance improvements and battle testing. We will look at how to enable people to build more full applications and games versus small demos. That includes disseminating the knowledge we‚Äôve gained from building a browser, full games, and complex applications using A-Frame. Via guides, frameworks, boilerplates, and open game projects!

item.description:
@aframevr https://t.co/pn9tTomYIN we just launched this prologue story for our game, @GenesisNoirGame! We built it using AFrame, check it out!

— Jeremy "Have you seen my kickstarter yet?" Abel (@jabelsjabels) January 18, 2018

Networked-Aframe v0.5 is live. It features Ownership Transfer and important bug fixes.

Ownership Transfer let's you take control of entities spawned by other users - a big step towards networked physics in @aframevr

Release notes and more info: https://t.co/Cv1pAa19eC pic.twitter.com/X12J6kbxNh

— Hayden Lee (@HaydenLee37) January 17, 2018

Exploring a 600kb world made in #AssetForge with @aframevr.

Next version of aframe-extras will include navmesh support with first-person controls, using three-pathfinding: https://t.co/DDwEWD795r // #threejs pic.twitter.com/TqWITxgAX8

— Don McCurdy (@donrmccurdy) January 14, 2018

I made a game!!
It was initially for the "Games Made Quick" hackathon but I ran out of time so I fixed it up and posted it late. Made with @twinethreads @aframevr and the building was made with @Archilogic3D's 3Diohttps://t.co/TdxgyJkqes

— Ada Rose Cannon ada@mastodon.social (@Lady_Ada_King) January 22, 2018

Life Update: After 4.5 amazing years I left @mozilla and I‚Äôm joining @feiss and @andgokevin to cook delicious stuff in the #WebVR space. We‚Äôre fully committed to @aframevr and the Web. Stay tuned, we‚Äôre moving fast and furiously. pic.twitter.com/JfRskpb5OI

— Pookage (@pookagehayes) December 10, 2017

Working on a demo that combines a lot of things using @aframevr & three.ar.js:
- AR ‚ÜîÔ∏è VR transition in the same scene
- camera effects (an intentional glitch effect shader)
- triggering events based on location of viewer's phone relative to the originhttps://t.co/ZyyF5wLIkJ pic.twitter.com/M3BjS9PYTr

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) December 14, 2017

Working on one of the most interesting @aframevr demos I've done in a while. pic.twitter.com/bJR6Fc5eml

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) December 13, 2017

Made a normal & diffuse map for this portrait of Ada Lovelace and put it up in a three.ar.js + @aframevr scene! Threw in some lighting and it made a really interesting, almost embossed, effect on one side!https://t.co/RrmfqgAzfk

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) December 14, 2017

Components

üèáüèΩ Published v4 of @aframevr animation component. Upgraded to #animejs v2. Much faster tweening of pos/rot/scale making use of recent @aframevr perf hooks. Use over <a-animation>. https://t.co/nPSVQEyhGh

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) December 14, 2017

Day 14 of #3December! Today I've made a simple @aframevr component for clicktorelease's #THREEjs vertex displacement shader!!! #WebVRhttps://t.co/X3RFzlc5J4 pic.twitter.com/SwNQUgJII9

— √Ålvaro Casado (@alvarocasadoc) December 14, 2017

@aframevr Bringing "responsive" to WebVR. Based on the connected controller, the responsive component will dynamically set your components accordingly. https://t.co/6YxsJJbVqd pic.twitter.com/e8ThFpDMdN

— Pardo Lab (@pardolab) December 10, 2017

Making lot of components for an @aframevr app and want to save 20 seconds from typing out the boilerplate each time? angle initlocalcomponent my-component -> my-component.js https://t.co/WIyqspJ29j

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) December 15, 2017

Today I've used @aframevr as a ECS wrapper for #THREEjs and I've written a simple component for measuring distances on a meshhttps://t.co/YsxG60R2j0 pic.twitter.com/IPUEudx2ys

— √Ålvaro Casado (@alvarocasadoc) December 15, 2017

Articles

Events

I want to create #VR content in VR but make it as fun as playing with Legos!

Slides, demo & Github https://t.co/auZDZ3rTd9 of the @AFrameVR Block-based in-#VR "editor" just showed at #yAllHands

(thanks for the pics ;) https://t.co/NHT9QcJgiA

— Fabien Benetou ‚úàÔ∏èüá∫üá∏Austin (@utopiah) December 14, 2017

Offline T-Rex VR Game by @malweene, @anialdam, @salad_milk_soup, me powered by @aframevr, created in the #WebVRContent17 event ü¶ñüéÆhttps://t.co/9t05Z9Zcry pic.twitter.com/p7CpdH3z0b

— Uri Shaked (@UriShaked) December 10, 2017

Some of the best tinkerers yesterday evening during Austin #WebVR Meetup, playing with @aframevr to help her younger sister learn faster (with super dad supervision!) pic.twitter.com/DzZqJgYqBT

— Fabien Benetou ‚úàÔ∏èüá∫üá∏Austin (@utopiah) December 13, 2017

Miscellaneous

To keep my @aframevr HTML organized, I template HTML with Nunjucks. Splitting HTML chunks to different files, looping through data structures, debug vs. prod env vars for which A-Frame build to use with auto-setting IP. I create in my Webpack a watcher to recompile on change.

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) December 13, 2017

Let the old give way to the new. I just removed VREffect / VRControls from @aframevr One of the first pieces of WebVR code I wrote back in July 2014 https://t.co/YCggNLc8pw

— Diego (@dmarcos) December 12, 2017

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 88 - 89
item.description:
We‚Äôre proud to announce the launch of our first WebVR experience! Visit Pierre Koenig‚Äôs Case Study House 22 in full 3D on your HTC Vive, desktop, or mobile device. Check it out! https://t.co/SljvOHRnQ2#VR #webvr #aframe #threejs #losangeles #midcentury #modern #architecture pic.twitter.com/iM8AJ8DYT3

— Paragram (@ParagramVR) November 19, 2017

Interactive #WebVR cloth simulation with @aframevr and #cannonjs for @htcvive, @OculusRift, and #WindowsMRhttps://t.co/2DT0aiBdQ3 pic.twitter.com/Bj2OymbznY

— Will Murphy üî•Eüå≥¬Ω1‚É£ (@Datatitian) November 18, 2017

12 Years of Nectar VR experience. Interactive exhibition https://t.co/eYwO3TPGkg developed with the cool web framework @aframevr #WebVR #VR #VirtualReality #12YearsNectar pic.twitter.com/ePyIl3RUYF

— Nectar Estudio (@nectarestudio) November 22, 2017

Working with the WebXR @mozillareality team adding new features using @aframevr A-Painter in AR letting you save drawings and pin in place when loading them pic.twitter.com/mbYZ3FX7YI

— Arturo Paracuellos (@arturitu) November 20, 2017
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre proud to announce the launch of our first WebVR experience! Visit Pierre Koenig‚Äôs Case Study House 22 in full 3D on your HTC Vive, desktop, or mobile device. Check it out! https://t.co/SljvOHRnQ2#VR #webvr #aframe #threejs #losangeles #midcentury #modern #architecture pic.twitter.com/iM8AJ8DYT3

— Paragram (@ParagramVR) November 19, 2017

Interactive #WebVR cloth simulation with @aframevr and #cannonjs for @htcvive, @OculusRift, and #WindowsMRhttps://t.co/2DT0aiBdQ3 pic.twitter.com/Bj2OymbznY

— Will Murphy üî•Eüå≥¬Ω1‚É£ (@Datatitian) November 18, 2017

12 Years of Nectar VR experience. Interactive exhibition https://t.co/eYwO3TPGkg developed with the cool web framework @aframevr #WebVR #VR #VirtualReality #12YearsNectar pic.twitter.com/ePyIl3RUYF

— Nectar Estudio (@nectarestudio) November 22, 2017

Working with the WebXR @mozillareality team adding new features using @aframevr A-Painter in AR letting you save drawings and pin in place when loading them pic.twitter.com/mbYZ3FX7YI

— Arturo Paracuellos (@arturitu) November 20, 2017

Projects

Today in #AR #arthistory (#ARthistory? lol) I used three.ar.js & @aframevr to explore "The Ambassadors" (1533) by Hans Holbein the Younger.
Love getting to play with perspective & the anamorphic skull in the painting from my bedroom, w/ just my phone!https://t.co/PLq1YYFcT3 pic.twitter.com/PWYZobvOON

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 29, 2017

This month marks 1 year of me playing with @aframevr! Here's one of my early experiments; a screen that shines its light onto the audience #WebVR #lighting pic.twitter.com/5tl2GATZyN

— Pookage (@pookagehayes) November 17, 2017

Updated my local #WebVR video player with now drag&drop and 360 support https://t.co/nR7mRZBUPj

Basic but convenient to quickly check your own videos in VR. Obviously no install, just visit the link and use. pic.twitter.com/tPcbWxiAej

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) November 21, 2017

Here's a demo for another AR technique I'm really excited about & still working on ‚Äî stacked image layers! I've always been interested in painting on stacked glass panels & this is heavily inspired by that. Made with @aframevr & three.ar.jshttps://t.co/drVjVVkxB1

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 29, 2017

The Never Ending Walk VR Experiment. Using @aframevr #VR
Find out the source in https://t.co/Ey53Ku9tZ2
Play with it in https://t.co/2T0HyQmeLi pic.twitter.com/RQKcFGAdSr

— Pedro Serapio (@PedroSerapio) November 18, 2017

Few days ago I hurt my shoulder resulting in a lot of pain. I have to do physical therapy. It's terribly boring, repetitive but‚Ä¶ I thought #VR could help.

So I made KineVR, a #WebVR experience to create exercises & regularly train https://t.co/GItKeftUE7 Feel free to extend it pic.twitter.com/doIbd9IXom

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) November 26, 2017

Made an @aframevr + #ARjs birthday card prototype! Cake model #MadeWithBlocks by Kris Tong

Card: https://t.co/BCBEL6izRH

Try out the AR bday message over here: https://t.co/HDm1Wkh7hW pic.twitter.com/wdDtq3TcLV

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 18, 2017

Took the #threejs SkinnedMesh example and made a fun little @aframevr component to generate & animate this little skinned cylinder + skeleton :)

example: https://t.co/hf69m2jkaL (view-source to see the component!) pic.twitter.com/Gr67hEgjKK

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 30, 2017

The stuff you can do using only declarative markup & some Cannon.js physics using @aframevr is mind blowing

(I love this GIF because a yellow block comes flying toward the camera, couldn't have asked for a better capture of a simulation tbh)https://t.co/zKUXJqAuHx pic.twitter.com/XIgF05hccH

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 27, 2017

Made my mom an AR card for her birthday (which is today üéâ) using @aframevr & #ARjs! pic.twitter.com/7Uz7dg6IZZ

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 27, 2017

Combined both of my @aframevr + three.ar.js ocean demos into a little video üåä V inspired to take this and run with the concept of discrete AR soundscapes co-existing :)https://t.co/vVrVovMV3e

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 27, 2017

Day 18 of #VR: Working on my next #aframevr creation, A Day in Paris. Figuring out how to create scenes in A-Frame while also having much Paris nostalgia. pic.twitter.com/3UVNk67jlC

— Lynn Fay (@elsieanimates) November 26, 2017

I made an @aframevr + three.ar.js underwater scene! With sound! üåä
‚ú®
Splashing sounds above the üåä, ambient underwater sounds below. Take a listen with the video below or you can try out the demo at https://t.co/qSsd8C30wr (if you have the WebARonAR(Kit|Core) browser) pic.twitter.com/3NdLlJ9Qkp

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 26, 2017

I made this surreal three.ar.js @aframevr scene designed with low lighting & blue + red lights.

It's super interesting to see that it works in this lowlight caf√©. Also, whenever I tap, I'm generating new "train track" geometry along curves. pic.twitter.com/6KrRvUfqIg

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 26, 2017

Some @aframevr #ARKit three.ar.js cubes to start the day pic.twitter.com/YjqAn9EJma

— C W E R V O 0 o ¬∞ ‚Ä¢ O 0 o O O ¬∞ o O 0 O o O o O ¬∞ (@acwervo) November 25, 2017

Components

Using a navmesh to constrain first-person movement. #threejs version up, @aframevr bindings coming soon.https://t.co/DDwEWD795r pic.twitter.com/Js2CQEtX17

— Don McCurdy (@donrmccurdy) November 25, 2017

Created a multi-video component for @aframevr to help to optimize and reduce lagging while loading and playing video textures on multiple geometries in a #webVR scene. https://t.co/0bB7Lg5OWT #gearvr pic.twitter.com/mDbQKFo5cB

— …à√∏rƒëƒÅ–ø ∆ßƒß‚±•œâ (@jshaw3) November 23, 2017

Articles

‚Äú10 Rules of Using Fonts in Virtual Reality‚Äù by @V_Kurbatov https://t.co/KYuCY1Cfkf

— Chris MacPherson (@ChrisMacSEA) November 28, 2017

Special VR Experience for testing or just for fun. Pick up your Google cardboard. #aframe #VRhttps://t.co/4Fb4BdmmxC

— Pedro Serapio (@PedroSerapio) November 11, 2017

Events

3 events in 1 week (!!) promoting an open #VirtualReality ecosystem through #webvr & @aframevr at @sunnyvalelib @QConSF and @srvef_Imagineer #EdTechConnect. Amazing turnout and excitement from young & old, devs & noobs at the potential of #OpenSource immersive media. pic.twitter.com/QiNWTNUA06

— Kieran Farr (@kfarr) November 19, 2017

The brave @dmarcos live coding on glitch.me shows how easy it is to create with @aframevr pic.twitter.com/j0RZoumLHy

— Xavier Ho üèπ üîú ‚úàÔ∏è OzViz 2017 (@Xavier_Ho) November 29, 2017

Favorite moment this week: class full of students & educators proudly showing off their @aframevr #webvr scene made in 30 min using only @glitch, their laptop web browser, and a dose of creativity at @srvef_Imagineer #EdTechConnect using this lesson plan: https://t.co/1XF57Eumkp pic.twitter.com/eVwZPOxEJP

— Kieran Farr (@kfarr) November 19, 2017

@steviemayhew talks again‚Ä¶ 5 minute lightning talk on @aframevr. Take your imagination out of your head and put it on someone else's head! #StripeConNZ

— PapaBear (@PapaBearNZ) November 24, 2017

Live coding demo with @aframevr #BBCUXCrunch @theuxcrunch pic.twitter.com/6lIuFEhxxi

— Rick Threlfall (@rick_threlfall) November 21, 2017

.@aframevr live coding session during @salad_milk_soup talk on #WebVR pic.twitter.com/7X8GxtE5zb

— Salva (@salvadelapuente) November 24, 2017

Miscellaneous

For those a bit wilder ü§† You can now directly manipulate position, rotation and scale of the object3D associated to an @aframevr entity. :https://t.co/88QVFGBhKw

— Diego (@dmarcos) November 21, 2017

For #threejs #webvr/@aframevr apps, use renderer.setTexture2D(texture, 0) to preload all textures up front. Uploading textures to GPU at runtime causes heavy frame drops.

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) November 17, 2017

Look at this @aframevr - @mavoweb demo @karger and I made!https://t.co/tg1XUx528a

Web Components + Mavo = A match made in heaven :)

— Lea Verou (@LeaVerou) November 22, 2017
